hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abbas: When the Prophet ﷺ stood for prayer during the night, he would say: 'O Allah, all praise is for You. You are the light of the heavens and the earth. All praise is for You. You are the sustainer of the heavens and the earth. All praise is for You. You are the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is in them. You are the truth, and Your word is truth, and Your promise is truth, and meeting You is truth, and Paradise is truth, and the Fire is truth, and the Hour is truth. O Allah, to You I have submitted, in You I have believed, upon You I have relied, to You I have turned, and with You I have disputed, and to You I have referred for judgment. Forgive me what I have sent forward and what I have left behind, what I have done in secret and what I have done openly. You are my God, there is no god but You.' Also narrated from al-Rabi' from Ubadah ibn al-Samit: When the Prophet ﷺ saw the crescent moon, he would say: 'Allah is greater, Allah is greater twice. All praise is for Allah. There is no might or power except with Allah. O Allah, I ask You for the good of this month, and I seek refuge in You from its evil and from the evil of the Day of Gathering.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Aisha: I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying before he died while leaning on my breast and I listened to him: 'O Allah, forgive me and have mercy on me, and join me with the Highest Companion.' Aisha said: And it reached us from Aisha that she said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'No prophet dies until he is given a choice.' So I heard him saying: 'O Allah, the Highest Companion.' So I knew that he was departing. Also from al-Rabi' from Ubadah ibn al-Samit from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ: Gabriel upon him be peace healed him while he had a fever, saying: 'In the name of Allah I heal you, from every ailment that harms you, from every envier if they envy, from every eye, and Allah's name heals you.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: A man came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and said: O Messenger of Allah, the livestock has perished and the roads have been cut off. Supplicate to Allah the Most High to send us mercy. Anas said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ supplicated, so it rained from Friday to Friday. Then a man came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and said: The houses have been destroyed, the livestock has perished, and the roads have been cut off. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ supplicated, and in his supplication he said: O Allah, upon the mountaintops and the hills and in the bottoms of the valleys and the places where trees grow. Anas said: The cloud then dispersed over Madinah like the opening of a garment. Al-Rabi' said: The hills are small mounds. And his saying that the cloud dispersed like the opening of a shirt collar means the cloud circled around Madinah and there was no cloud between it and the sky.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah: Keep to (insisting on) 'O Possessor of Majesty and Honor' for he said if someone supplicates with it, it is rarely that it is not answered. Also, it reached me from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ that he said: Every Prophet has a supplication, and I wanted to reserve my supplication as an intercession for my nation on the Day of Resurrection. Also, it reached me from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: Beseech your Lord and supplicate to Him during ease, for indeed Allah said: Whoever supplicates to Me during ease, I shall answer him during hardship. Whoever asks Me, I shall give him. Whoever humbles himself before Me, I shall exalt him. Whoever beseeches Me, I shall have mercy on him. Whoever seeks My forgiveness, I shall forgive him. Also narrated: Abu Ubaidah said it reached me from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ through Jabir ibn Zayd that he said: It reached me from Abu Hurayrah that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Our Lord, the Blessed and Most High, says when the last third of the night remains: Who will supplicate to Me so I answer him? Who will ask Me so I give him? Who will seek My forgiveness so I forgive him?

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Mas'ud: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ came to us in the gathering of Sa'd ibn Ubadah, and Bashir ibn Sa'd said to him: Allah has commanded us to pray upon you, so how should we pray upon you? The Prophet ﷺ was silent until we forgot that he had asked him, then he said: Say, O Allah, send blessings upon our Prophet Muhammad and upon the family of Muhammad, as You sent blessings upon Abraham, and bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, as You blessed Abraham and the family of Abraham among the worlds. Indeed, You are worthy of praise and full of glory. And the greeting as you already know it. Al-Rabi' said: Abu Ubaidah said: The greeting be upon you, O Prophet, and the mercy of Allah and His blessings. This is how we learned it.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Whoever says: There is no god but Allah, alone with no partner for Him, for Him is the kingdom and for Him is all praise, and He is powerful over all things - one hundred times in a day, it is an equivalent of freeing ten slaves, and one hundred good deeds are written for him, and one hundred evil deeds are erased from him, and it is a protection from Satan for that day until he reaches evening. And no one comes with something better than what he has brought except one who has done more than that.

hadiths.english_translation: Chapter: What is permitted in marriage and what is not permitted

potential_issues.issue: This is a chapter heading, not a hadith with a chain of narrators
potential_issues.impact: Cannot be analyzed as a hadith - this is organizational/metadata text

Topics: Chapter heading

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated: The Prophet ﷺ said: Whoever marries a woman with the intention of her wealth while seeking her wealth, Allah will not bless him with her, and whoever marries a woman with the intention of her beauty will find in her what he wishes.

narrators.name: Abu Ubaidah
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Yusuf ibn Hakkam al-Hadani

narrators.name: Jabir ibn Zayd
narrators.full_name: Jabir ibn Zayd al-Azdi

narrators.name: Husain ibn Uqbah
narrators.full_name: Husain ibn Uqbah al-Thaqafi

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib

chainIssues: Abu Ubaidah is weak (Da'if)
Husain ibn Uqbah has weak reliability

potential_issues.issue: Abu Ubaidah is a weak narrator (Da'if)
potential_issues.impact: Weak narrator at the beginning weakens the chain

potential_issues.issue: Husain ibn Uqbah has weak reliability (La Ba'sa Bihi)
potential_issues.impact: Additional weakness in the chain

Topics: Marriage with the intention of wealth
Marriage with the intention of beauty
Divine blessing in marriage

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated: A woman should not reject a proposal from a man of righteousness and wealth, for if she does, she will be the loser and will find evil in her condition.

narrators.name: Abu Ubaidah
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Yusuf ibn Hakkam al-Hadani

narrators.name: Jabir ibn Zayd
narrators.full_name: Jabir ibn Zayd al-Azdi

narrators.alternative_names: Sulayman ibn Arqam, Abu Mua'dh al-Basri

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib

potential_issues.issue: Abu Mua'dh is graded as Saduq

Topics: Women accepting proposals from righteous and wealthy men

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Jabir: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: A woman is the guardian of her husband's family and property, and she will be questioned about them.

narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Yusuf ibn Hakkam al-Hadani

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah: It reached me from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ that he said: The best women are those of the Quraysh, they are kind to their children and protect the property of their husbands.

narrators.name: Abu Ubaidah
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Yusuf ibn Hakkam al-Hadani

narrators.name: Walid ibn Bashir
narrators.full_name: Walid ibn Bashir

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib

chainIssues: Abu Ubaidah is weak (Da'if)
Use of 'balaghani' indicates indirect transmission
Walid ibn Bashir is unknown (Majhul)

potential_issues.issue: Abu Ubaidah is a weak narrator (Da'if) using 'balaghani' (indirect transmission)
potential_issues.impact: Weak narrator with indirect transmission severely compromises reliability

potential_issues.issue: Walid ibn Bashir is unknown (Majhul)
potential_issues.impact: Unknown narrator makes the chain very weak

Topics: Virtue of Qurayshi women
Women's kindness to children
Women's protection of husband's property

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Dimam ibn al-Sa'ib from Jabir: The best of our women are those who do not anger their husbands and do not utter bad language.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Jabir: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: The best woman is she who is righteous, obeys her husband and creates beauty in her appearance for him.

narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Yusuf ibn Hakkam al-Hadani
